front.title: The Role of DMIF in Support of RTP MPEG-4 Payloads

abstract.t: This memorandum describes how RTP carrying MPEG-4 payloads interactswith the MPEG-4 Access Unit layer through the MPEG (DeliveryMultimedia Integration Framework) DMIF. DMIF is used to passinformation essential for the packing and unpacking of MPEG-4 streamsinto RTP as well as for adjusting the MPEG-4 AL-PDU lengths to bewithin the path MTU. DMIF interprets the RTCP reports by comparing its statistics to therequested MPEG-4 media based QoS. If the statistics fail to meet therequested QoS then action is taken to either continue with the impairedperforamce, upgrade the network service class, scale down the stream ordelete the stream. This specification is a product of the Audio/Video Transport workinggroup within the Internet Engineering Task Force. Comments aresolicited and should be addressed to the working group's mailing listat rem-conf@es.net and/or the authors.
